text.0: these fires associate with indra are awake bringing their light when first the dawn begins to shine.
text.1: may heaven and earth great pair observe our holy work we claim for us this day the favour of the gods.
text.2: yea for ourselves we claim the grace of heaven and earth of Śaryaṇāvān of the hills and mother streams.
text.3: for innocence we pray to sūrya and to dawn so may the flowing soma bring us bliss today.
text.4: may the great twain the mothers heaven and earth this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness.
text.5: may morning sending forth her light drive sin afar we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.6: may this first dawn bring us the host of gracious gods rich may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth.
text.7: the wrath of the malignant may we keep afar we pray to kindled agni for feilicity.
text.8: dawns who come forward with the bright beams of the sun and at your earliest flushing bring to us the light.
text.9: shine ye on us today auspicious for renown we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.10: free from all sickness may the mornings come to us and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze.
text.11: the aśvin pair have harnessed their swiftmoving car we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.12: send us today a portion choice and excellent o savitar for thou art he who dealeth wealth.
text.13: i cry to dhiṣaṇā mother of opulence we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.14: further me this declaring of eternal law the law of gods as we mortals acknowledge it.
text.15: the sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.16: this day we pray with innocence in strewing grass adjusting pressingstones and perfecting the hymn.
text.17: thou in the Ādityas keeping movest restlessly we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.18: to our great holy grass i bid the gods at morn to banquet and will seat them as the seven priests.
text.19: varuṇa indra mitra bhaga for our gain we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.20: come hither o Ādityas for our perfect weal accordant help our sacrifice that we may thrive.
text.21: pūṣan bṛhaspati bhaga both aśvins and enkindled agni we implore for happiness.
text.22: Ādityas gods vouchsafe that this our home may be praiseworthy prosperous our heroes sure defence.
text.23: for cattle for our sons for progeny for life we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
text.24: this day may all the maruts all he near us with aid may all our fires be well enkindled.
text.25: may all gods come to us with gracious favour may spoil and wealth he ours and all possessions.
text.26: he whom ye aid o deities in battle whom ye protect and rescue from affliction.
text.27: who fears no danger at your milklibation such may we be to feast the gods ye mighty.
